

```{r}
#reading in data spreadsheets
clinton <- read.csv("CLINTON1998-2001.csv")
bush <- read.csv("BUSH2001-2009.csv")
obama <- read.csv("OBAMA2009-2017.csv")
trump <- read.csv("TRUMP2017-2020.csv")
biden <- read.csv("BIDEN2020-2021.csv")
```

```{r}
#finding the total sum of firearms for each presidential term
sum(clinton$totals)
sum(bush$totals)
sum(obama$totals)
sum(trump$totals)
sum(biden$totals)
```
```{r}
#show purchase rate difference between Bush and Obama years

```




```{r}
#dividing Obama's term by 2 (so it is equal to other 4 year term presidents)
#assuming the purchase rate continues, multiplying Biden's term by 2 to represent the next two years
sum(clinton$totals)*2 #clinton was in office 1996-2001, data is 1998-2001 (missing two years, so multiplying to estimate 4 year term)
sum(bush$totals)
sum(obama$totals)/2 #dividing Obama's term by 2 so it estimates a 4 year term
sum(trump$totals)
sum(biden$totals)*2 #only been in office about two years, so multplying by two to estimate four year term
```

```{r}
#finding max total value during each year
max(clinton$totals)
max(bush$totals)
max(obama$totals)
max(trump$totals)
max(biden$totals)
```


```{r}
#finding entry for max firearm sales during Clinton Administration
library(data.table)
clinton2 <- data.table(clinton)
clinton2
setkey(clinton2, "totals")
head(clinton2)
clinton2[.(max(clinton$totals))]
```
